s0195.chinese: 諸廟及章臺、上林皆在渭南。
s0195.literal: All the ancestral temples, Zhangtai, and Shanglinyuan were south of the Wei River.
s0195.idiomatic: All the ancestral temples, Zhangtai, and Shanglinyuan were south of the Wei River.

s0196.chinese: 秦每破諸侯，寫放其宮室，作之咸陽北阪上，南臨渭，自雍門以東至涇、渭，殿屋複道周閣相屬。
s0196.literal: Every time Qin defeated a feudal state, it replicated their palaces and built them on the northern slopes above Xianyang, south facing the Wei River, from Yongmen eastward to the Jing and Wei rivers; palace buildings with elevated passages and encircling galleries were all connected.
s0196.idiomatic: Every time Qin defeated a feudal state, it replicated their palaces and built them on the northern slopes above Xianyang, south facing the Wei River, from Yongmen eastward to the Jing and Wei rivers; palace buildings with elevated passages and encircling galleries were all connected.

s0197.chinese: 所得諸侯美人鐘鼓，以充入之。
s0197.literal: Beautiful women, bells, and drums obtained from the feudal lords were all brought in to fill them.
s0197.idiomatic: Beautiful women, bells, and drums obtained from the feudal lords were all brought in to fill them.

s0198.chinese: 二十七年，始皇巡隴西、北地，出雞頭山，過回中。
s0198.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, the First Emperor toured Longxi and Beidi, went out through Jitou Mountain, and passed through Huizhong.
s0198.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, the First Emperor toured Longxi and Beidi, went out through Jitou Mountain, and passed through Huizhong.

s0199.chinese: 焉作信宮渭南，已更命信宮為極廟，象天極。
s0199.literal: There he built Xin Palace south of the Wei River, then renamed Xin Palace as Ji Temple, symbolizing the celestial pole.
s0199.idiomatic: There he built Xin Palace south of the Wei River, then renamed Xin Palace as Ji Temple, symbolizing the celestial pole.

s0200.chinese: 自極廟道通酈山，作甘泉前殿。
s0200.literal: From Ji Temple a road led directly to Lishan, and he built the front hall of Ganquan.
s0200.idiomatic: From Ji Temple a road led directly to Lishan, and he built the front hall of Ganquan.

s0201.literal: He built a walled roadway connecting it from Xianyang.
s0201.idiomatic: He built a walled roadway connecting it from Xianyang.

s0202.literal: That year, one rank of nobility was granted.
s0202.idiomatic: That year, one rank of nobility was granted.

s0204.chinese: 二十八年，始皇東行郡縣，上鄒嶧山。
s0204.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, the First Emperor traveled east through the commanderies and counties and ascended Mount Zouyi.
s0204.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, the First Emperor traveled east through the commanderies and counties and ascended Mount Zouyi.

s0205.chinese: 立石，與魯諸儒生議，刻石頌秦德，議封禪望祭山川之事。
s0205.literal: He erected a stone monument and, debating with Confucian scholars from Lu, had inscriptions carved on stone praising Qin's virtue, discussing the feng and shan sacrifices and the worship of mountains and rivers.
s0205.idiomatic: He erected a stone monument and, debating with Confucian scholars from Lu, had inscriptions carved on stone praising Qin's virtue, discussing the feng and shan sacrifices and the worship of mountains and rivers.

s0206.chinese: 乃遂上泰山，立石，封，祠祀。
s0206.literal: He then ascended Mount Tai, erected a stone monument, performed the feng sacrifice, and made offerings.
s0206.idiomatic: He then ascended Mount Tai, erected a stone monument, performed the feng sacrifice, and made offerings.

s0207.chinese: 下，風雨暴至，休於樹下，因封其樹為五大夫。
s0207.literal: On the descent, wind and rain suddenly arrived; he took shelter under a tree, and thereupon enfeoffed that tree as one of the Five Great Officials.
s0207.idiomatic: On the descent, wind and rain suddenly arrived; he took shelter under a tree, and thereupon enfeoffed that tree as one of the Five Great Officials.

s0208.literal: He performed the shan sacrifice at Liangfu.
s0208.idiomatic: He performed the shan sacrifice at Liangfu.

s0209.literal: On the erected stone monument, the inscription read:
s0209.idiomatic: On the erected stone monument, the inscription read:

s0210.chinese: 皇帝臨位，作制明法，臣下修飭。
s0210.literal: The Emperor ascended the throne, created systems and clarified laws; his ministers were cultivated and orderly.
s0210.idiomatic: The Emperor ascended the throne, created systems and clarified laws; his ministers were cultivated and orderly.

s0211.chinese: 二十有六年，初并天下，罔不賓服。
s0211.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, he first unified all under Heaven, and none were not submissive.
s0211.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, he first unified all under Heaven, and none were not submissive.

s0212.chinese: 親巡遠方黎民，登茲泰山，周覽東極。
s0212.literal: He personally toured the distant regions and the common people, ascended this Mount Tai, and surveyed the eastern extremity.
s0212.idiomatic: He personally toured the distant regions and the common people, ascended this Mount Tai, and surveyed the eastern extremity.

s0213.chinese: 從臣思跡，本原事業，祗誦功德。
s0213.literal: His attending ministers reflected on the traces, traced the origins of his achievements, and respectfully recited his merits and virtue.
s0213.idiomatic: His attending ministers reflected on the traces, traced the origins of his achievements, and respectfully recited his merits and virtue.

s0214.chinese: 治道運行，諸產得宜，皆有法式。
s0214.literal: Governance functioned smoothly, all products were properly suited, all had regulations.
s0214.idiomatic: Governance functioned smoothly, all products were properly suited, all had regulations.
